sentences.text: MALLINCKRODT PUBLIC LIMITED COMPANY  Proxy Statement   21
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation philosophy is designed to attract, retain and motivate our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The core principles of that compensation philosophy are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation should strongly align the interests of executive officers with those of patients, employees and shareholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation policies and practices should support effective governance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The focus should be on total compensation opportunity (base salary, annual incentive compensation and long- term incentive compensation) with an explicit role for each element;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation should be competitive, but not excessive, in order to attract and retain talented executive officers who can achieve our long-term strategic goals and create shareholder value;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation that results from performance should deliver above target compensation when we exceed our target goals and below target compensation when our performance falls short of our goals;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation should reward corporate, group and individual performance to encourage collaboration and collective interests, while rewarding key contributors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation should support our business strategy in the areas of patient focus, customer focus, globalization, operational excellence and innovation, as well as our talent strategy;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The reward elements should be balanced, with an emphasis on performance-based compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation goals and practices should be transparent and easy to communicate, both internally and externally and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Goal setting is a key activity and should be conducted in a rigorous manner resulting in targets that reflect stretch, yet achievable, levels of performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22  MALLINCKRODT PUBLIC LIMITED COMPANY  Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Say-on-Pay Shareholder Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 Annual General Meeting, we provided our shareholders with the opportunity to cast an advisory vote on our 2015 executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over 97% of the votes cast were voted in favor of the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the 2016 say-on-pay vote indicates that our shareholders are generally supportive of our approach to executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we did not make changes to our executive compensation arrangements in fiscal 2016 in response to our say-on-pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the future, we will continue to consider the outcome of advisory say-on-pay votes and other shareholder feedback when making compensation decisions regarding our executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Decision-Making
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the HRCC and Management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRCC makes all decisions regarding senior management compensation, which includes our NEOs and certain other senior officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRCC reviews our executive compensation policies, practices and plans on an ongoing basis to determine whether they are consistent with our compensation philosophy and objectives, and whether they need to be modified in light of changes in our business or the markets in general.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRCC meets periodically with management to review compensation policies and specific levels of compensation paid to officers and other key personnel and approves compensation and programs for executive officers other than our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRCC reports to the Board on compensation paid to officers and other key personnel and makes recommendations to the Board regarding CEO compensation policies and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our CEO makes recommendations to the HRCC regarding salary adjustments and the setting of annual and long-term incentive targets and awards for executive officers other than himself, including the other NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n determining the compensation of an executive officer, the HRCC considers various factors, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company, business unit and individual performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market data on compensation opportunities of officers with similar responsibilities at comparable companies;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The officers current and future responsibilities and potential contribution to our performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retention considerations; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation levels of our executives with similar levels of responsibility (internal equity).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Compensation Consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRCC utilizes the services of independent compensation consultants from time to time and has the sole authority to retain, compensate and terminate any such compensation consultants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, a transition occurred from Frederic W. Cook & Company ("Cook") to Willis Towers Watson ("WTW") as independent compensation consultants to the HRCC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRCC assessed the independence of Cook and WTW and determined that Cook and WTW are independent and that no conflicts of interest exist currently or existed during fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cook and WTW report directly to the HRCC and do not provide executive compensation services to, or on behalf of, any other part of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cook provided review of HRCC materials, including executive positioning relative to the external market and also provided advice to the HRCC on compensation issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WTW also has been retained by the Nominating and Governance Committee as its independent compensation consultant in all matters relating to non- employee director compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WTW reviews HRCC materials, attends HRCC meetings, reviews our peer group and competitive positioning of individual executives versus market, assists the HRCC with program design, provides advice to the HRCC as compensation issues arise and provides recommendations on certain specific aspects of our compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peer Group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When reviewing compensation programs for the executive officers, the HRCC considers the compensation practices of a group of companies of reasonably similar size and that may be in competition with us for talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the rapidly changing business landscape of the pharmaceutical industry, including consolidations, it is important to maintain a current view of peer competitors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRCC periodically reviews the peer group and approves changes, based on the recommendation of WTW.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the HRCC approved a peer group that included the 16 companies listed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The specific companies were selected using objective size criteria, in a range that we believe is appropriate for benchmarking executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the peer group includes companies with which we compete for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: business, executive talent and/or investment dollars.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Performance Measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016 Global Bonus Plan, corporate measures were the primary basis for assessing performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For executive officers other than our CEO, the CEO recommends individual payouts based on individual targets, corporate performance, and individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRCC reviews the CEO's recommendations and approves final payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Financial Objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal year 2016, the corporate performance measures were based upon adjusted earnings per share, or adjusted EPS, net sales revenue and free cash flow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRCC believes these measures are key drivers of longer term value creation and key indicators of the current and future strength of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted EPS is defined as diluted earnings per share calculated in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles ("GAAP"), as adjusted for certain items and their related tax effects.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted EPS is an important measure because it provides a focus on profitable growth and expense control, and is viewed as a strong indicator of sustained performance over the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net sales revenue represents net sales calculated in accordance with GAAP, as adjusted for certain items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net sales revenue is an important measure because it is a leading indicator of performance and value creation and provides a clear focus on top-line growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Free cash flow is defined as cash flow from operating activities less net capital expenditures, both calculated in accordance with GAAP, as adjusted for the impacts to operating cash flows from certain items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Free cash flow is an important measure because it provides focus on generating cash to fund operations and research, focuses executives on expense control and is expected to lead to long-term shareholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The weighted average funding for the 2016 Global Bonus Plan could range from 0% to 200% of target based upon our performance against these measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the HRCC may apply discretion to further increase funding by 50%, up to a total of 300% and subject to the 162(m) plan funding maximum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, our long-term incentive compensation program consisted of a mix of performance units (weighted 40%), non-qualified stock options (weighted 40%) and restricted units (weighted 20%) granted under our Stock and Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We grant performance units to create incentives for executives to achieve long-term performance goals aligned with our multi-year business strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance units represent unissued ordinary shares; we do not ssue ordinary shares until the applicable performance-based vesting requirements are satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vesting requirements for performance units granted to NEOs during fiscal 2016 are based upon adjusted Net Revenue Compound Annual Growth Rate ("CAGR") and relative total shareholder return, or relative TSR, each weighted at 50%, over a three-year performance period (fiscal 2016  fiscal 2018).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net Revenue CAGR for the Company will be calculated for FY16 - FY18 (September 26, 2015 - September 28, 2018) using non-GAAP Net Sales Revenue where GAAP Net Sales Revenue has been adjusted to exclude the impact of both acquisitions and divestitures during the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Relative TSR means our total shareholder return as compared against a broad performance peer group of pharmaceutical and life sciences companies, listed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This group of companies is broader than the peer group of companies used for competitive comparisons of executive compensation, and it includes some companies that are much larger or much smaller than Mallinckrodt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRCC believes that use of a larger comparison group for measuring our TSR better reflects our market performance against the broad industry, even though some of the companies in the performance group would not be reasonable comparators for the compensation peer group, because of extreme differences in size.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRCC periodically reviews the TSR peer group and approves
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: changes, based on the recommendation of WTW.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The relative TSR measure provides a total picture of our performance and will balance the achievement of absolute internal goals (Net Revenue CAGR) with relative performance against our peers in a measure that is directly linked with long-term shareholder value creation.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We grant restricted units to align the interests of management and shareholders and to promote retention of key talent over the vesting period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted units represent unissued ordinary shares; we do not issue ordinary shares until the applicable vesting requirements are satisfied.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the vesting requirements are satisfied, the executive receives ordinary shares without restriction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted units granted to NEOs during fiscal 2016 vest one- quarter annually beginning on the first anniversary of the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRCC with input from our CEO, for the other NEOs, and considering each NEO's level of responsibility and market data for similar positions at companies in our peer group, sets long-term incentive grant value targets as percentages of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the target levels for each of the NEOs were increased to reflect levels of responsibility and market data for similar positions in our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRCC then converted these grant values to equity amounts based on grant-date fair values.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By using this value approach, the number of stock options, restricted units and performance units will vary from year to year based on, among other things, our share price at the time of grant, even though the awards may have the same dollar value under the valuation methodologies.

sentences.text: Other Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide NEOs the same benefits that are provided to all employees, including defined contribution retirement benefits, health and welfare benefits, and an employee stock purchase plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our executive officers are provided with certain additional benefits, intended to be competitive with the practices of our peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs are eligible to participate in our Retirement Savings and Investment Plan (Mallinckrodt Retirement Savings Plan), which is our 401(k) plan available to all eligible U.S. employees, and our Supplemental
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Savings and Retirement Plan (Mallinckrodt Supplemental Savings Plan), our non-qualified deferred compensation plan in which executive officers and other senior employees may participate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Mallinckrodt Supplemental Savings Plan is a so- called excess plan that extends the 401(k) benefits beyond Internal Revenue
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 30  MALLINCKRODT PUBLIC LIMITED COMPANY  Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information regarding the Mallinckrodt Supplemental Savings Plan, see Executive Compensation  Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bonus for Stock Exchange Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs are eligible to participate in our Bonus for Stock Exchange Program which provides an additional opportunity for executive officers and other senior employees to accumulate ordinary shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unde this program, participating employees may elect to exchange all or a portion of their bonus (not to exceed the target level) for restricted units granted on January 3, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company matches an additional 25% amount in restricted units as compensation for the delay in receiving the bonus and the risk of forfeiture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts deferred pay out in the form of ordinary shares, in three equal annual installments beginning on the first anniversary of the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Trudeau and Mr. Harbaugh elected to participate in this program and exchanged 10% and 15% respectively, of their bonuses for restricted units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expatriate Benefits / International Assignment Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide benefits to our employees who are sent on an expatriate assignment outside of their home country, which are designed to relocate and support them while on these assignments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits generally include a housing allowance (or company provided housing in certain locations), transportation allowance (or company provided transportation in certain locations), a cost of living differential, where applicable, a vacation allowance based on the cost of a plane ticket to the employees home location, and company paid education for approved dependents in locations where public education is not an option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Phillips was provided with these benefits during all or part of fiscal 2016 as he is an expatriate based in the United Kingdom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, we ensure that employees who are sent on an assignment outside of their home country are subject to substantially the same income tax liability as they would have paid in the U.S. pursuant to our tax equalization program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each such employee is responsible for a theoretical U.S. income tax liability based on an estimate of his or her anticipated U.S. income tax liability, and we are responsible for any home country and assignment country taxes in excess of that amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We deduct hypothetical income taxes from the employees compensation during the tax year and pay any assignment country taxes on his or her behalf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Trudeau, Dr. Scholz and Dr. Phillips were each provided with these benefits during all or part of fiscal 2016 as Mr. Trudeau and Dr. Scholz are employed on a partial secondment arrangement to the United Kingdom and Dr. Phillips is an expatriate based in the United Kingdom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Health and Welfare Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The health and welfare benefits we provide to the NEOs are offered to all eligible U.S. based employees and include medical, dental, prescription drug, vision, life insurance, accidental death and dismemberment, business travel accident, personal and family accident, flexible spending accounts, short- and long-term disability coverage and an employee assistance program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain an executive physical examination program and an executive financial and tax planning program for executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These programs are intended to encourage executives to proactively manage their health and complex financial/tax situations, thereby enabling them to focus on the business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefits are periodically benchmarked versus comparable companies and intended to be competitive for our industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our business travel expense policy, we will reimburse executive officers who are required to spend 90 days per year in the United Kingdom for up to four trips per year for their spouse or partner to visit them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, when we request a spouse or partner to attend a business meeting, such as our annual national sales recognition program for top performers or an offsite meeting of our executive committee, we reimburse executive officers for expenses related to this travel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In both of these circumstances, we reimburse executive officers for the income taxes associated with these travel expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee Stock Purchase Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective October 1, 2013, we began maintaining a broad-based employee stock purchase plan (the "Prior Plan") that provides eligible employees, including the NEOs, with the opportunity to purchase ordinary shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible employees authorized payroll deductions to be made for the purchase of ordinary shares and, for fiscal 2016 through June 30, 2016, we provided a 15% matching contribution for all employees who participated in this program for up to $25,000 of an employees payroll deductions in the calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shares were purchased on the open market by a designated broker and were required to be held by participants for 12 months after purchase.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In September 2015, our Board of Directors adopted our 2016 Employee Stock Purchase Plan, which we refer to as the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ESPP, subject to shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESPP is designed to qualify as an employee stock purchase plan under Section 423 of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2016 Annual General Meeting, shareholders approved the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MALLINCKRODT PUBLIC LIMITED COMPANY  Proxy Statement   31
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ESPP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Prior Plan was terminated June 30, 2016 upon implementation of the ESPP and no additional shares were offered for purchase under the Prior Plan after that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ESPP was implemented effective July 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible employees authorize payroll deductions to be made for the purchase of ordinary shares and, for fiscal 2016 beginning July 1, 2016, we provided a 15% discount for all employees who participated in this program for up to $25,000 of an employees payroll deductions in the calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, shares utilized were Treasury shares and are required to be held by participants for 12 months after purchase.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain an executive severance plan that provides benefits to our senior executives upon an involuntary termination of employment for any reason other than cause, permanent disability or death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide this plan to enable our executives to devote their full attention to our business by ensuring they will have some financial security in the event of an involuntary termination of employment without cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance benefits, in the form of base salary continuation, bonus and health benefits are generally payable for 18 months (24 months for our CEO) following a qualifying termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives whose employment is involuntarily terminated without cause during the first twelve months of employment receive base salary continuation and health benefits for 9 months (12 months for our CEO) and do not receive a bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Receipt of these benefits is conditioned upon the executive signing a release of any claims against us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain a change in control plan that provides benefits to certain senior executives upon an involuntary termination of employment or good reason resignation that occurs during a period shortly before and continuing after a change in control (a double-trigger arrangement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide this plan to encourage our executives to remain neutral in the face of a potential transaction that may benefit shareholders but result in the loss of the executives employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits are generally payable following a qualifying termination of employment in a lump-sum cash payment equal to 1.5 times (2 times for our CEO) the sum of the executives base salary and the average of the executives bonus for the previous three fiscal years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional benefits provided upon a change in control termination include full vesting of outstanding equity awards (double-trigger), continued subsidy for health plan premiums for an 18-month period (24 months for our CEO) and outplacement services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Receipt of change in control severance benefits is conditioned upon the executive signing a release of any claims against us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan does not provide excise tax gross-ups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share Ownership Requirements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To reinforce the alignment of management and shareholder interests, the Board established share ownership requirements under which executive officers are expected to hold equity with a value expressed as a multiple of base salary as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining an executives ownership, shares held directly as well as shares underlying restricted units (less a 40% tax assumption) are included.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares underlying unexercised stock options and unvested performance units are not included n the calculation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until the required share ownership level is achieved, the executives are required to retain at least fifty percent of net profit shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net profit shares are shares remaining after payment of the exercise price, if applicable, and taxes upon the exercise of stock options, vesting of restricted units, and earn-out of performance units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the end of fiscal 2016, Mr. Trudeau, Mr. Harbaugh and Dr. Scholz met their ownership requirements and the other executive officers have made progress toward meeting their ownership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Anti-Hedging/Anti-Pledging Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Insider Trading Policy prohibits directors, officers and employees from entering into or trading in puts, calls, cashless collars, options or similar rights and obligations or any other hedging activity involving our securities, other than the exercise of a Company-issued stock option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our policy also prohibits directors, officers and employees from purchasing our securities on margin, borrowing against our securities held in a margin account or pledging our securities as collateral for a loan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, an exception may be granted by our General Counsel if the individual clearly demonstrates the financial capacity to repay the loan without resort to the pledged securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Recovery Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a restatement of financial or operating results due to material non-compliance with financial reporting requirements, the HRCC is authorized to recover ("clawback") any incentive compensation that was overpaid to certain employees, including NEOs, taking into account such factors as the HRCC deems appropriate, including whether the employee engaged in misconduct or negligent conduct that caused or contributed to the restatement and the amount of any overpayment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deductibility of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HRCC has generally intended to structure our executive compensation in a manner designed to qualify for deductibility under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code when consistent with our overall compensation program objectives, while also maintaining maximum flexibility in the design of our compensation programs and in making appropriate payments to NEOs.

sentences.text: (1) The amounts reported include amounts deferred by the NEOs during fiscal 2016 under our Supplemental Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All amounts reported in this column are also included in the Salary and/or Non-Equity Incentive Plan Compensation columns in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) The amounts reported include amounts that we credited to our Supplemental Savings Plan on behalf of the NEOs in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These amounts are included in the amounts set forth in the All Other Compensation column of the Summary Compensation Table for fiscal 2016 and are specifically broken out in footnote 4 to the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) The amounts reported include earnings credited to the NEOs account in the Supplemental Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings on amounts credited to the Supplemental Savings Plan are determined by investment selections made by each NEO in investment alternatives that generally mirror investment choices offered under the Retirement Savings Plan (our 401(k) plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) The amounts reported for each NEO includes the NEOs total balance in our Supplemental Savings Plan as of September 30, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supplemental Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Supplemental Savings Plan, participants, including NEOs, may defer up to 50% of their base salary and 75% of their annual bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide matching credits based on the participants deferred base salary and bonus at the same rate that such participant is eligible to receive matching contributions under the Retirement Savings Plan and Company credits on any cash compensation (i.e., base and bonus) that the participant earns during a calendar year in excess of applicable IRS limits ($265,000 for 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants are fully vested in matching and Company credits (including earnings on such credits) upon completion of two years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Supplemental Savings Plan is a non-qualified deferred compensation plan that is maintained as an unfunded top-hat plan and is designed to comply with Internal Revenue Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts credited to the Supplemental Savings Plan as participant deferrals or Company credits may also be credited with earnings (or losses) based upon investment selections made by each participant from investments that generally mirror investments offered under the Retirement Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants may elect whether they will receive a distribution of their Supplemental Savings Plan account balances upon termination of employment or at a specified date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Distributions can be made in a lump sum or in up to 15 annual installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Retirement Savings Plan, we make an automatic contribution of three percent (3%) of an employees eligible pay, irrespective of whether the employee contributes to such plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, we match fifty cents ($0.50) for every one dollar ($1.00) employees contribute, up to the first six percent (6%) of eligible pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 40  MALLINCKRODT PUBLIC LIMITED COMPANY  Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION OF EXECUTIVE OFFICERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential Payments upon Termination
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all of the NEOs, severance benefits are payable pursuant to the Mallinckrodt Severance Plan for U.S. Officers and Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Severance Plan, benefits are payable to eligible executives, including NEOs, upon an involuntary termination of employment for any reason other than cause, permanent disability or death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Post- ermination benefits consist of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuation of base salary for a period of 18 months (24 months for our CEO);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment of 1.5 times the average of the executives bonus for the previous three fiscal years (two times the average of the previous three fiscal year bonuses for our CEO);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuation of health and dental benefits at active employee rates for a period of up to 18 months (24 months for our CEO);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 12 months accelerated vesting of unvested stock options;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 12 months to exercise vested stock options (unless a longer period is provided in the applicable award agreement);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 12 months accelerated vesting of unvested restricted unit awards that are subject solely to time-based vestin
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 12 months accelerated vesting of unvested performance unit awards if, and to the extent that, the HRCC determines that the applicable performance criteria have been attained;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outplacement services, at our discretion, for up to 12 months; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment of a pro-rata portion of the executives annual incentive cash award for the fiscal year in which such executives employment terminates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, employees with less than one year of service will be entitled to continuation of one-half base salary and will not be entitled to any payment in connection with the executives bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a termination of employment other than for cause, including an involuntary termination of employment where the executive becomes eligible for severance benefits, executives, including NEOs, forfeit all unvested restricted unit and performance unit awards and stock options that do not vest within 12 months after the executives employment termination date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all NEOs, change in control severance benefits are payable pursuant to the Mallinckrodt Change in Control Severance Plan for Certain U.S. Officers and Executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Change in Control Plan, benefits are payable to eligible executives, including NEOs, only if the plans double trigger requirements are satisfied, meaning hat, in order to receive any of the following benefits, the executive must experience an involuntary termination of employment or good reason resignation during a period that begins 60 days before and ends 2 years after a change in ontrol.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Post-termination benefits consist of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A single lump sum payment equal to 18 months of the executives base salary (24 months for our CEO)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A single lump sum payment equal to 1.5 times the average of the executives bonus for the previous three fiscal years (2 times the average of the previous three fiscal year bonuses for our CEO);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continuation of health and dental benefits at active employee rates for a period of up to 18 months (24 months for our CEO);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Full vesting of unvested stock options;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 12 months to exercise vested stock options (unless a longer period is provided in the applicable option agreement);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Full vesting of unvested restricted unit awards that are subject solely to time-based vesting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Full vesting of unvested performance unit awards if, and to the extent that, the HRCC determines that the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: applicable performance criteria have been or will be attained or would have been attained during the 18-month period after the executives employment terminates (24-month period for our CEO);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Outplacement services, at our discretion, for up to 12 months; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment of a pro-rata portion of the executives annual incentive cash award for the fiscal year in which such executives employment terminates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MALLINCKRODT PUBLIC LIMITED COMPANY  Proxy Statement   41
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION OF EXECUTIVE OFFICERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payment of benefits under our Severance Plan and our Change in Control Plan is conditioned upon the executive executing a general release in favor of us and is subject to the terms of the Non-Competition, Non-Solicitation, and Confidentiality Agreement by and between the executive and us, under which the executive agreed not to disclose confidential Company information at any time and not to compete with us nor solicit our employees or customers, for a period of one year following termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We may cancel benefits that are payable or seek to recover benefits previously paid if the executive does not comply with these provisions or violates the release of claims.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments may be delayed until six months after termination of employment if necessary to comply with Internal Revenue Code Section 409A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a termination of employment for cause, executives, including NEOs, are not eligible for severance benefits under our Severance Plan or our Change in Control Plan and forfeit all unvested stock options, restricted units and performance units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the stock options, restricted units and performance units include a claw-back feature pursuant to which we may recover the amount of any profit the NEO realized upon the exercise of stock options, or the vesting of restricted units or performance units, during the 12-month period that occurs immediately prior to the executive officers involuntary termination of employment for cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of our Severance Plan and our Change in Control Plan, as well as the claw-back feature discussed in the preceding sentence, cause means substantial failure or refusal of the NEO to perform the duties and responsibilities of his job as required by us, violation of any fiduciary duty owed to us, conviction of a felony or misdemeanor, dishonesty, theft, violation of our rules or policies, including a violation of our Guide to Business Conduct, or other egregious conduct that has or could have a serious and detrimental impact on us and our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the Change in Control Plan, good reason means any retirement or termination of employment by the NEO that is not initiated by us and that is caused by any one or more of the following events, in each case, without the NEOs written consent:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) assignment to the NEO of any duties inconsistent in any material respect with the NEOs authority, duties or responsibilities as in effect immediately prior to the change in control;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a material diminution in the authority, duties or responsibilities of the supervisor to whom the NEO is required to report as in effect immediately prior to the change in control;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a material change in the geographic location at which the NEO must perform services to a location that is more than 50 miles from the NEOs principal place of business immediately preceding the change in control;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) a material reduction in the NEOs compensation and benefits, taken as a whole, as in effect immediately prior to the change in control;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) our failure to obtain a satisfactory agreement from any successor to assume and agree to perform our obligations to the NEO under such plan; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) a material diminution in the budget over which the NEO retains authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, good reason will only exist if the NEO provides written notice stating the good reason event, we do not cure such event, and the NEO terminates employment within a certain period of time after the end of the cure period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Termination Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of our annual incentive plan and equity plan provide for certain benefits upon a NEOs termination of employment due to death, disability or retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For this purpose, normal retirement occurs where an executive officer terminates employment after attaining age 60 and the sum of the executives age and years of service equals at least 70.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the annual incentive plan, NEOs are eligible to receive a pro-rated annual incentive cash award based on the number of days that the executive officer was employed by us during the fiscal year upon death, disability or normal retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the equity plan, NEOs are eligible to receive full vesting of stock options, restricted units and performance units upon death, disability or normal retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below reflects the amount of compensation that would become payable to each of our NEOs under existing plans if the NEOs employment had terminated on September 30, 2016, the last day of fiscal 2016, given the NEOs service levels as of such date and, if applicable, based on our closing stock price as of that date, which was $68.45.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These benefits are in addition to benefits available prior to the occurrence of any termination of employment, including under then-exercisable stock options, and benefits available generally to salaried employees, such as distributions under the Retirement Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The actual amounts that would be paid upon a NEOs termination of employment or in connection with a change in control can be determined only at the time of any such event.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to a number of factors that may affect the amount of any
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: benefits provided upon the events discussed below, actual amounts paid or distributed may be higher or lower than indicated in the table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Factors that could affect these amounts include the timing during the year of any such event, our stock price, the executives age and years of service, the attained level of performance for performance units, and any additional agreements or arrangements we may enter into in connection with any change in control or termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a more complete understanding of the table, please read the narrative disclosures that follow the table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MALLINCKRODT PUBLIC LIMITED COMPANY  Proxy Statement   43
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION OF EXECUTIVE OFFICERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Severance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Involuntary Termination (other than for cause).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all NEOs other than our CEO, the cash severance amount in this scenario represents continuation of the NEOs base salary, as of September 30, 2016, for an 18-month severance period, plus an amount equal to 1.5 times the average of the NEOs annual incentive cash awards for the previous three fiscal years (i.e., fiscal 2015, 2014 and 2013), payable during the 18-month severance period and on our normal payroll schedule.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our CEO, the amount represents continuation of his base salary, as of September 30, 2016, for a 24-month severance period, plus an amount equal to two times the average of his annual incentive cash awards for the previous three fiscal years, payable during the 24-month severance period and on our normal payroll schedule.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all NEOs, we assume that such executive officers experience an involuntary termination of employment (other than for cause) after the change in control that renders them eligible for benefits under the Mallinckrodt Change in Control Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the cash severance amount for all NEOs other than our CEO represents a lump-sum payment equal to 1.5 times the NEOs base salary as of September 30, 2016, plus an amount equal to 1.5 times the average of the NEOs annual incentive cash awards for the previous three fiscal years (i.e., fiscal 2015, 2014 and 2013).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our CEO, the amount represents a lump-sum payment equal to two times his base salary as of September 30, 2016, plus an amount equal to two times the average of his annual incentive cash awards for the previous three fiscal years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Applicable to both the cash severance termination scenarios, in situations where the NEO did not have a full three year history of annual incentive cash awards due to not having commenced employment prior to fiscal 2013, the average calculated represents a prorated average calculated as the sum of the annual incentive cash awards divided by the length of service provided during the prior three fiscal years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bonus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Involuntary Termination (other than for cause).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of an involuntary termination (other than for cause), executive officers are entitled to a pro-rata payment of the annual incentive cash award based on the number of days they were employed by us during the fiscal year.

sentences.text: Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, requires our officers and directors and persons who beneficially own more than 10 percent of our ordinary shares to file reports of ownership and changes in ownership of such ordinary shares with the SEC and NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These persons are required by SEC regulations to furnish us with copies of all Section 16(a) forms they file.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a matter of practice, our administrative staff assists our officers and directors in preparing initial reports of ownership and reports of changes in ownership and files those reports on their behalf.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our review of the copies of such forms we have received, as well as information provided and representations made by the reporting persons, we believe that all required Section 16(a) reports were timely filed during our fiscal year ended September 30, 2016.

sentences.text: AUDIT AND AUDIT COMMITTEE MATTERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit and Non-Audit Fees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2015 and 2016, Deloitte & Touche LLP charged fees for services rendered to us as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal 2015 Fiscal 2016   Audit Fees $ 6,670,920 $ 6,084,240   Audit-Related Fees 4,035,000 1,000,000   Tax Fees 990,000 772,000   All Other Fees 2,220,500    Total $ 13,916,420 $ 7,856,240
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Fees include fees for professional services rendered for the year-end audits of our consolidated and combined financial statements and internal control over financial reporting, reviews of the financial statements included in our Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q, consents and statutory audits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit-Related Fees would include fees for audits of agreed-upon or expanded audit procedures related to accounting records required to respond to or comply with financial, accounting or regulatory reporting matters; consultations on the accounting or disclosure treatment of transactions or events and/or the actual or potential impact of final or proposed rules, standards or interpretations by the SEC, FASB or other regulatory or standard-setting bodies; and attest services not required by statute or regulation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Fees would include fees for tax compliance services as well as fees for tax planning services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Other Fees include services relating to project methodology and support for a non-financial system data integration initiative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy on Audit Committee Pre-Approval of Audit and Permissible Non-Audit Services
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has adopted a pre-approval policy that provides guidelines for audit, audit-related, tax and other permissible non-audit services that may be provided by our independent auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the policy, our Corporate Controller supports the Audit Committee by providing a list of proposed services to the Committee, monitoring the services and fees pre-approved by the Committee, providing periodic reports to the Committee with respect to pre-approved services and coordinating with management and the independent auditors to support compliance with the policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the policy, the Audit Committee annually pre-approves the audit fee and terms of the engagement, as set forth in the engagement letter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also annually approves a specified list of audit, audit-related and tax services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any service not included in the specified list of services must be submitted to the Committee for pre-approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent auditors may not begin work on any engagement without confirmation of Committee pre-approval from our Corporate Controller or her delegate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the policy, the Audit Committee has delegated to its Chair the authority to pre-approve the engagement of the independent auditors in her discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chair reports all such pre-approvals to the Committee at the next Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 48  MALLINCKRODT PUBLIC LIMITED COMPANY  Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AUDIT AND AUDIT COMMITTEE MATTERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee Report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As more fully described in its charter, the Audit Committee oversees Mallinckrodts financial reporting process on behalf of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has day-to-day responsibility for the Companys financial reporting process, including assuring that the Company develops and maintains adequate financial controls and procedures and monitoring and assessing compliance with those controls and procedures, including internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mallinckrodts independent auditors are responsible for auditing the annual consolidated financial statements prepared by management, expressing an opinion as to whether those financial statements fairly present the financial position, results of operations and cash flows of the Company in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States and discussing with the Audit Committee any issues they believe should be raised.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent auditors are also responsible to the Audit Committee and the Board for testing the financial accounting and reporting control systems, for issuing a report on the Companys internal control over financial reporting and for such other matters as the Audit Committee and Board determine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the performance of its oversight function, the Audit Committee has reviewed and discussed with management, the internal auditors and the independent auditors the consolidated financial statements for the fiscal year ended September 30, 2016 filed with the U. S. Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management represented to the Audit Committee that these consolidated financial statements were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States (US GAAP).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee has:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discussed with the independent auditors the matters required to be discussed pursuant to the applicable Auditing Standards relating to communication with audit committees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Received from the independent auditors the written disclosures and letter required by the applicable requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board regarding the independent auditors communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discussed with the independent auditors their independence from the Company and its management; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Considered whether the independent auditors provision of non-audit services to the Company is compatible with maintaining the auditors independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon the review and discussions referred to above, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board of Directors that Mallinckrodts audited consolidated financial statements prepared in accordance with US GAAP be included in its Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended September 30, 2016 filed with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSALS 1(a) THROUGH 1(j): ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the recommendation of the Nominating and Governance Committee, the Board has nominated for election at the 2017 Annual General Meeting a slate of 10 nominees, all of whom are currently serving on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The nominees are Melvin D. Booth, David R. Carlucci, J. Martin Carroll, Diane H. Gulyas, JoAnn A. Reed, Angus C. Russell, Virgil D. Thompson, Mark C. Trudeau, Kneeland C. Youngblood, M.D. and Joseph A. Zaccagnino.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Biographical information, including qualifications, regarding each of the 10 nominees is set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The election of directors will take place at the Annual General Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to be elected as a director, each nominee must receive the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast by the holders of ordinary shares represented at the Annual General Meeting in person or by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are entitled to one vote per share for each of the 10 nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are not aware of any reason why any of the nominees will not be able to serve if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the directors elected will serve until the conclusion of the 2018 Annual General Meeting or until his or her earlier death, resignation or removal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current Directors Nominated for Re-Election  Proposals 1(a) through 1(j)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1(a)  Melvin D. Booth
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Booth, age 71, has been Chairman of the Board and a director since June 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is also a member of our Audit and Portfolio Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Booth has been a director of Catalent Pharma Solutions, Inc. since 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has also been a strategic advisor in life sciences to Genstar Capital (a private equity firm) since 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Booths previous public company board experience includes serving as Lead Director of Millipore from 2004 to 2010, and as a director of MedImmune from 1998 to 2005 and Human Genome Sciences from 1995 to 1998.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Booth was President of MedImmune from 1998 until his retirement at the end of 2003.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Booth was Chairman of the Board and a director of eResearch Technologies from 2012 to 2016 and Chairman of the Board and a director of PRA International from 2004 to 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Booth was President of Human Genome Sciences from 1995 to 1998.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He held a variety of domestic and international positions with Syntex from 1981 to 1995, including serving as President of its U.S. pharmaceuticals business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Booth has been active in U.S. pharmaceutical industry organizations and is a past Chairman of the Pharmaceuticals Manufacturers Association of Canada.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Booth received a B.S. degree in accounting from Northwest Missouri State University where he was also awarded an honorary Doctor of Science degree.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is also a Certified Public Accountant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Booths qualifications to serve on our Board include his significant experience in leadership positions at pharmaceutical companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1(b)  David R. Carlucci
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Carlucci, age 62, has been a director since June 2013 and is Chair of our Human Resources and Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Carlucci was President and Chief Operating Officer of IMS Health Incorporated, an information services company, from October 2002 until January 2005, when he was named Chief Executive Officer and President.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He became Chairman the following year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Carlucci retired from IMS Health in December 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Carlucci held several senior executive level positions at IBM from 1976 to 2002, including responsibilities for operations in the U.S., Canada, and Latin America.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Carlucci has been a director of MasterCard International since 2006 and served as Chairman of its Human Resources and Compensation Committee from 2006 to 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Carlucci also served as a member of the advisory board of Mitsui USA, one of the worlds most diversified comprehensive trading, investment and service companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Carlucci received a B.A. in political science from the University of Rochester.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Carluccis qualifications to serve on our Board include his significant experience as an executive and/or board member of publicly traded and private companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Carroll, age 67, has been a director since June 2013 and is Chair of our Compliance Committee and a member of our Nominating and Governance Committee.

sentences.text: He served as President and Chief Executive Officer of Boehringer Ingelheim Corporation and of Boehringer Pharmaceuticals, Inc. from 2003 until 2011 and as a director of Boehringer Ingelheim Corporation from 2003 until December 2012.

sentences.text: He joined the organization in 2002 as President of Boehringer Pharmaceuticals, Inc.

sentences.text: Mr. Carroll worked at Merck & Company, Inc. from 1976 to 2001.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1972 to 1976, Mr. Carroll served in the United States Air Force where he attained the rank of Captain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has served as a director of Therapeutics MD, Inc. since March 2015, as a director of Catalent Pharma Solutions since July 2015 and as a director of Inotek since March 2016 and as Chairman of Inotek since June 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Carroll served as a director of Durata Therapeutics, Inc. from August 2014 until November 2014 when it was acquired by Actavis and as a director of Vivus, Inc. from May 2013 until September 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Carroll received a B.A. in accounting & economics from the College of the Holy Cross and a M.B.A. from Babson College.

sentences.text: Mr. Carrolls qualifications to serve on our Board include his significant experience in leadership positions at pharmaceutical companies.

sentences.text: Proposal 1(d)  Diane H. Gulyas
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Gulyas, age 60, has been a director since June 2013 and is a member of our Human Resources and Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Gulyas served as a member of our Audit Committee until November 17, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Gulyas retired in April 2014 from E. I. du Pont de Nemours and Company where she served as the President of DuPonts Performance Polymers division since 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She had also served as the Vice Chairman of the DuPont-Teijin Films global joint venture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Gulyas has served as a director of W.R. Grace & Co. since January 2015 and serves as chair of its Corporate Responsibility Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She also has served as a director of Expeditors International of Washington, Inc. since November 2015 and serves as a member of its Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 2009 until 2012, Ms. Gulyas served as a director and as a member of the Finance Committee of Navistar International Corporation, a leading manufacturer of commercial trucks, buses, RVs, defense vehicles and engines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Gulyas received her B.S. in chemical engineering from the University of Notre Dame.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Gulyas qualifications to serve on our Board include her extensive executive experience with chemical and manufacturing companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1(e)  JoAnn A. Reed
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Reed, age 61, has been a director since June 2013 and is Chair of our Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Reed is a healthcare services consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Reed served as an advisor to the Chief Executive Officer of Medco Health Solutions, a leading pharmacy benefit manager, from April 2008 to April 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She previously served as the Senior Vice President, Finance and Chief Financial Officer of Medco until 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon joining Medco in 1988, Ms. Reed served in finance and accounting roles of increasing responsibility and was appointed Senior Vice President, Finance in 1992 and Chief Financial Officer in 1996.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Medco, Ms. Reeds experience included finance roles at Aetna/American Reinsurance Co., CBS Inc., Standard and Poors Corporation and Unisys/Timeplex Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Reed has been a director of American Tower Corporation since 2007 and a director of Waters Corporation since 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She served as a director of Health Management Associates, Inc. from 2013 to 2014 and as a trustee of St. Marys College of Notre Dame from 2006 to 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Reed received a B.B.A. in business administration from St. Marys College.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She received her M.B.A. in finance and international marketing cum laude from Fordham University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Reeds qualifications to serve on our Board include her experience as a healthcare services consultant and her financial expertise and knowledge of financial statements, corporate finance and accounting matters.

sentences.text: Proposal 1(f)  Angus C. Russell
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Russell, age 61, has been a director since August 2014 and is Chair of our Portfolio Committee and a member of our Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Russell served as a director of Questcor Pharmaceuticals, Inc. from June 2013 until Questcor was acquired by us in August 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Russell served as Chief Executive Officer of Shire Plc, a leading global specialty biopharmaceutical company, from 2008 until his retirement in April 2013 and was a member of its Board of Directors from 1999 to 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1999 to 2008, Mr. Russell served as Chief Financial Officer of Shire.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Shire, Mr. Russell served at ICI, Zeneca, and AstraZeneca, most recently as VP of Corporate Finance at AstraZeneca.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Russell has served as the non-executive Chairman of Revance Therapeutics, Inc. since March 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has served as a director of BioTime, Inc. since December 2014 and as a director of Therapeutics MD, Inc. since March 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was a director of InterMune, Inc. from 2011 to 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Russell is a Chartered Accountant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He holds an honorary Doctor of Business Administration from Coventry University, U.K. Mr. Russells qualifications to serve on our Board include his significant experience as an executive and/or board member of publicly traded pharmaceutical companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1(g)  Virgil D. Thompson
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Thompson, age 77, has been a director since August 2014 and is a member of our Human Resources and Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Thompson served as a director of Questcor Pharmaceuticals, Inc. from 1996 and most recently served as Chairman of its Board until Questcor was acquired by us in August 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From July 2009 to July 2015, Mr. Thompson served as Chief Executive Officer and director of Spinnaker Biosciences, Inc., a privately held ophthalmic drug delivery company, and now serves as Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Thompson is also the Chairman of the Board of Aradigm Corporation, a public pharmaceutical company, a director of Promet Therapeutics, a private company, and a director of GenZ Corporation, a private company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Thompson served as the President, Chief Executive Officer and as a director of Angstrom Pharmaceuticals, Inc. from 2002 until 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 2000 until 2002, Mr. Thompson was President, Chief Executive Officer and a director of Chimeric Therapies, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 1999 and 2000, Mr. Thompson was President, Chief Operating Officer and, from 1994 through 2013, a director of Bio-Technology General Corporation, a pharmaceutical company (subsequently Savient Pharmaceuticals, Inc.).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Thompson holds a B.S. degree in pharmacy from the University of Kansas and a J.D. degree from The George Washington University Law School.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Thompsons qualifications to serve on our Board include his extensive knowledge of Questcors business and operations and his experience as both an executive officer and a director of publicly traded and private corporations in the pharmaceuticals industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1(h)  Mark C. Trudeau
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Trudeau, age 55, has been President, Chief Executive Officer and a director since June 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In anticipation of our spin transaction with Covidien plc, Mr. Trudeau joined Covidien in February 2012 as a Senior Vice President and President of its Pharmaceuticals business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He joined Covidien from Bayer HealthCare Pharmaceuticals LLC USA, the U.S. healthcare business of Bayer AG, where he served as Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He simultaneously served as President of Bayer HealthCare Pharmaceuticals, the U.S. organization of Bayers global pharmaceuticals business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, he served as Interim President of the global specialty medicine business unit from January to August 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Bayer in 2009, Mr. Trudeau headed the Immunoscience Division at Bristol-Myers Squibb.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During his 10-plus years at Bristol-Myers Squibb, he served in multiple senior roles, including President of the Asia/Pacific region, President and General Manager of Canada and General Manager/Managing Director in the United Kingdom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Trudeau was also with Abbott Laboratories, serving in a variety of executive positions, from 1988 to 1998.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Trudeau has served as a director of TE Connectivity Ltd. since March 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was appointed a trustee of the Donald Danforth Plant Life Center in St. Louis in December 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Trudeau holds a Bachelors degree in chemical engineering and a M.B.A., both from the University of Michigan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Trudeau is familiar with all aspects of our business and has extensive and diverse industry experience and managerial expertise and a proven record of leadership to serve as our President, CEO and director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 52  MALLINCKRODT PUBLIC LIMITED COMPANY  Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSALS REQUIRING YOUR VOTE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1(i)  Kneeland C. Youngblood, M.D.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Youngblood, age 61, has been a director since June 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is a member of our Compliance and Nominating and Governance Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Youngblood is a founding partner of Pharos Capital Group, a private equity firm that focuses on providing growth and expansion capital/buyouts in healthcare, business services and opportunistic investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Youngblood served as a director of Gap Inc. from 2006 to 2012, a director of Starwood Hotels and Resorts from 2001 to 2012, a director of Burger King Corporation from 2004 to 2010 and a director of iStar Financial from 1998 to 2001.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Youngblood has been serving as a director of Energy Future Holdings Corp, an electric utility provider, since 2007 and a director of Pace Holdings Corp., a company formed for the purpose of effecting a merger, share exchange, asset acquisition, stock purchase, reorganization or similar business combination with one or more businesses, since 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Youngblood is a physician by training, with over 15 years of experience in emergency medicine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is also a member of the Council on Foreign Relations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Youngblood earned a B.A. in politics from Princeton University and an M.D. from the University of Texas Southwestern Medical School.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Youngbloods qualifications to serve on our Board include his extensive experience in healthcare practice, policy and business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 1(j)  Joseph A. Zaccagnino
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Zaccagnino, age 70, has been a director since June 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is Chair of our Nominating and Governance Committee and a member of our Compliance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Zaccagnino served as a director of Covidien plc and Chair of its Nominating and Governance Committee from its incorporation in 2007 until it was acquired by Medtronic plc in January 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Zaccagnino served as President, Chief Executive Officer and director of Yale New Haven Health System and its flagship Yale-New Haven Hospital from 1991 until his retirement in 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also served as a director of NewAlliance Bancshares, Inc. from 1991 until it was acquired in 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Zaccagnino served on the board of the National Committee for Quality Healthcare from 1995 until 2005, and was elected Chairman of the Board in 2003.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1999 until 2006 he served as a director and from 2004 to 2006 as Chairman of the Board of VHA Inc., a for-profit cooperative of community owned health systems and their physicians that provides supply chain and group purchasing services through their subsidiaries, Novation and Provista.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Zaccagnino received a B.S. (business administration) from the University of Connecticut and a M.P.H. (healthcare management) from Yale University School of Medicine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Zaccagninos qualifications to serve on our Board include his broad healthcare management and governance experience and his knowledge of healthcare policy and regulation, patient care delivery and financing and of clinical research and medical technology assessment, all of which provide our Board with unique insights and a keen perspective on the complexities of the healthcare sector and on the priorities of and challenges facing our company and the purchasers of our products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise instructed, the proxies will vote FOR each of these directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
